label: Unsupported
short_description: No external bracing. The body must provide all stability internally. Highest core/lower back demand.

label: Single-Limb Braced
short_description: One limb (hand or foot) is used for balance. Reduces spinal load but still requires rotational core stability.

label: Double-Limb Braced
short_description: Two limbs are used for bracing (e.g., knee and hand on a bench). Provides high stability and eliminates most rotational demand.

label: Torso Braced
short_description: The torso is fully supported by a pad or bench. Maximum isolation of the target muscles; core and lower back are completely offloaded.

label: Elbow Fixed
short_description: The elbows are pinned against a fixed surface. Eliminates all shoulder cheating and isolates the upper arm.

label: Lower Body Locked
short_description: The lower body is mechanically locked down (like pulldown pads). Allows for force production exceeding body weight.
